info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 22 at 1:00AM EST by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...Light Snow Coming to an End, but Snow Covered Roads Will Result in Hazardous Travel Overnight and Early Saturday Morning... An area of low pressure and an upper-level disturbance moving northeast along the South Carolina/North Carolina coast spread light snow back northwest across the foothills and piedmont of northern North Carolina into Southside Virginia and the Virginia piedmont Friday evening. The snowfall was ending from west to east early this morning and no significant additional accumulations of snow are expected at this time. Snowfall was confined generally to areas east of a line from Wilkesboro, to Stuart, to Martinsville, to Danville, to Charlotte Court House. Snowfall amounts ranged from 1/4 to 1/2 inch around Wilkesboro, Pilot Mountain, Danbury, King, Reidsville, and Danville to 1 inch at Stuart. Then further east from Charlotte Court House to South Boston to Yanceyville, snowfall ranged from 1 to 2 inches. Temperatures will remain well below freezing in these areas this morning. In fact it will be bitterly cold this morning as winds increase and temperatures fall mostly in the mid and upper teens by daybreak. Untreated roads and walkways will remain slick and hazardous through the morning hours. Travel through this region is discouraged this morning. If you must travel in this area this morning, please use extreme caution, reduce speed, leave extra distance between you and the vehicle in front of you, and allow extra time to reach your destination. Given the bitterly cold temperatures, conditions will be slow to improve after daybreak. Given the bitter cold, please consider keeping an extra blanket in your vehicle as well as a full set of winter weather attire, such as a heavy coat, gloves, ear muffs, a scarf and/or hat with you in the event that you become stranded.
